data.title: Company Profile
data.meta_description: Sky - Television and broadband internet services. Acquired by Comcast Corporation. Raised funding from 2 investors. Founded by Rupert Murdoch in the year 1990. Sky has 4295 competitors.

Sky - About the company

What does Sky do?

Sky UK Limited, formerly British Sky Broadcasting and BSkyB is a telecommunications company which serves the United Kingdom. Provides television, broadband internet services, and fixed-line telephone services to consumers and businesses in the United Kingdom. The company was formed in November 1990 by the equal merger of Sky Television and British Satellite Broadcasting. Following BSkyB's 2014 acquisition of Sky Italia and a majority 90.04% interest in Sky Deutschland in November 2014, its holding company British Sky Broadcasting Group plc changed its name to Sky plc. The United Kingdom operations also changed the company name from British Sky Broadcasting Limited to Sky UK Limited, still trading as Sky. Sky UK Limited is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sky plc.

Which sectors and market segments does Sky operate in?

Sky serves in the B2C space in the Telecom market segments.

The primary business model of Sky is :Telecom > Telecom Operators > ***** **** > ***** ******

Sky's acquisition details

Sky got acquired by Comcast Corporation on Sep 23, 2018 at an acquisition amount of $40B. It was facilitated by Centerview Partners and Evercore .

Click here to take a look at Sky 's acquisition in detail

Sky's funding and investors

How much funding has Sky raised till date?

Sky is a funded company.

Who are Sky's investors?

Sky has 2 institutional investor s including Elliott Management and Independents United.

Who is the current CEO of Sky?

Dana Strong is the CEO of Sky .

Sky's Competitors and alternates

Competitive landscape of Sky

Sky ranks 3 rd among 4295 competitors which include ViaSat, Starry and EarthLink. 80 of its competitors are funded while 318 have exited. Overall, Sky and its competitors have raised over $6.02B in funding across 229 funding rounds involving 306 investors. There are 24 public and 294 acquired companies in the entire competition set.
